Description: Pottery cinerary urn with superficial resemblance to canopic jars of Egypt; body, egg shaped with a circular flat base and two handles shaped like arms; lid modelled in the shape of a head with the beard and moustache indicated by incised lines, a pointed chin and the pupils of the eyes are formed by shallow depressions, hole at the top of the head, broken and reconstructed, the nose has been restored.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (H246)
Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (D215)
CVA British Museum 7 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 10, British Museum 7 (IVBa pl. 7, 3)
